publicationStmt.authority: Centre for Computing in the Humanities, King's College London

availability.p: All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://inslib.kcl.ac.uk/

support.p: Marble stele tapering towards the top, moulded above, broken at the bottom: 0.52-0.465 1.42 0.37. On the right and left sides are a series of graffiti in different hands; there is a relief of a horse's head on the reverse face, which is not inscribed:.

layoutDesc.layout: Inscribed on face 1, the front face, with a across the full face, at the top, b in two columns i (left) and ii (right) below it. Graffito texts on face 2, to the left, and face 3 to the right; on face 3, two columns, i to the left, ii to the right.

handDesc.handNote: Face 1: Augustan. 0.015-0.02; the dedication and for homonymous patronyms, 0.03. L for ἔτους.
Faces 2 and 3: sizes varying, 0.015-0.04; varying forms of Ε, Σ, Ω.

provenance.p: Cyrene: Agora, probably in the Square; found before 1941.

encodingDesc.p: Marked-up according to the EpiDoc Guidelines version 8

div.head: Bibliography
div.p: , 7, p. 20f, figs. 13-16, whence , 1962.363, and, with observations by J.M. Reynolds, 20.741, 324497, , 291f., whence , 1967.680; (part) , 7.

a, lines 1-17: (Jahr) 34; zur Zeit des Priesters des Apoll Isokrates des Klearchos und (des Priesters) des Imperator Caesar Sohn Gottes Augustus, Melanippos des Lysanias: die Triakatiarchen Istros (des Istros) des Agathinos, Igisan des Onomarchos, Archippos des Archippos, Eumelidas des Eumelidas, den Aporytiazon Zenion des Sosarchos, die Gymnasiarchen Apollonius des Akusagoras, Orthidas des Philokomos, Polianthes des Antimachos, und von den Presbytern Sarapion des Aristarchos . . .

1.a: Year 34; when the priest of Apollo was Isokrates son of Klearchos, and the priest of the Emperor Augustus son of deified Caesar was Melanippos som of Lysanias; the leaders of the triakatioi Istros son of Agathinos, Igisan son of Onomarchos, Archhippos son of Archippos, Eumelidas son of Eumelidas; the master of riding Zenion son of Sosarchos; the gymnasiarchs Apollonios son of Akousagoras, Orthiadas son of Philokomos, Polianthes son of Antimachos, and gymnasiarch of the seniors Sarapion son of Aristarchos.

b.i Aiglanor son of Ptolemaios, Ptolemaios son of Ptolemaios, Sarapion son of Aristandros, Sosarchos son of Zenion, Onomarchos son of Igisan, Iasis son of Etearchos, Serapion son of Klearchos, Theuchrestos son of Herilochos, Hagesarchos son of Diokles, Aristoteles son of Diokles, Serapion son of Serapion, Amphimedes son of Bark(a)ios, Leon son of Leon, Apollonios son of Apollonios, Diobysios son of Hyrathis, Aristomachos son of Sogenes, Barthybas son of Barthybas, Dionysios son of Themison, Euphranor son of Theudoros, Iason son of Sauritas, Theuchrestos son of Apollodoros, Sotadas son of Apollodoros, Magas son of Aialan, Hierax son of Irenaos, Thaliarchos son of Apollodoros, Iason son of Iason, Tisimachos son of Iason, Menestheus son of Sosistratos, Iason son of Iason, Leon son of Leon, Aristomenes son of Philokles, Battos son of Arimman, Andronikos son of Orion, Herakleidas son of Ptolemaios, Herakleidas son of Herakeidas, Alexis son of Alexis, Thaliarchos son of Alexis, Kallimachos son of Alexis, Timarchos son of Alexis, Ioulios son of Iesous, Damokritos son of Sogenes, Philokles son of Lysanias, Dionysios son of Philokles, Demetrios son of Hagemachos.

b.ii Leonidas son of Neopolis, Theudoros son of Neopolis, Ammonios son of Dionysios, Lykos son of Kallikles, Sokkonios son of Sokkonios, Kallignotos son of Kallignotos, Theukrisios son of Theuchrestos, Karnedas son of Theuchrestos, Apollonios son of Leon, Aristis son of Ameinias, Theudoros son of Nikanor, Philippos son of Ameinias, Thaliarchos son of Philokles, Philippos son of Nikias, Ammonios son of Hagemachos, Aiglanor son of Aristoteles, Kallippos son of Dexarchos, Nikostratos son of Nikostratos, Nikostratos son of Nikostratos, Polianthes son of Karnedas, Ammonios son of Agathokles, Simon son of Pothon, Timarchos son of Akesandros, Alexis son of Alexis, Apollodoros son of Thaliarchos, Aristis son of Dionysios, Theukrisios son of Patron, Theudotos son of Theudotos, Dionysios son of Olympos, Barthybas son of Barthybas, Elazar son of Elazar, Agathokles son of Elazar, Onomarchos son of Leonidas, Alexandros son of Poseidonios.
c Aiglanor and Ptolemaios sons of Ptolemaios

2.i Sodamos. Iason son of Theudotos. Year 54, Mnasion son of Telesarchos. Year 54, Iason son of Kriton. Year 54, Nikaios son of Markos. Year 55, Eum[- ]. Y Year 55, Philokomos son of Philon. Year 55, Igisan son of Bolakles. Nikaios son of Nikaios. . . . Sodamos son of Eukleidas. Year 55, Protomachos. Year 55. Philinos son of Apollonios . . . Year 55, Thoas son of Lysimachos. Ptolemaisan. Ptolemaion. Eglanor son of Euphranor. Kallippos son of Neikippos . . . Lykos son of Menandros. Philon son of Philothalos. Year 69 Serapion. Year 55, Lykos son of Demetrios. . . of Leonidas.

3.i
Year 58 Agathonemos. Year 55, Arimmas. Year 54, Ithallammon son of Thallammon. . . . Theuchrestos son of Krinis. Theudoros, Soteles, Philothales, Aristippos sons of Aristippos. . . . Euphris son of Deinis. Chaireas son of Ioudas. Lyon son of Aiglanor. Hagesarchos son of Sosis. Eirenaios son of Hippisas. Leukaspis son of Theudoros. Simon son of Orion. Diokles son of Diophantos. Year 54, Athenodoros son of Athenodoros. Philistion. Year 54, Etearchos son of Barkaios. . . Lykos son of Asklepos. ?of Kephalon. Diokles. Year 55, Euphris son of Euphris. . . . Kleonemos son of Aristis. Year 40, Eumelidas ? son of Odyris. Year 55, Akesandros son of Ptolemaios. Saphon . . . Dion. Damakles son of Damakles
3.ii Year 55, Attalos son of Attalos. Year 55, Epikrates. Euphris

1.a.4, For the priest of Augustus at Cyrene, see also nos. C.276, C.416, C.737. His name is used to date an inscription also in nos.C.276 and C.737; and the practice suggests that his office was annual only.
1.b.i.40 and ii.22: For the Jewish names see Lüderitz, loc. cit.; for examples of Jewish names in ephebic lists elsewhere (Koroneia in Messenia and Iasos in Caria), see Robert, Hellenica III, 100.
b.ii.31, 32: Probably Jewish, but perhaps rather a version of the native name transliterated by Herodotus IV.164.4 as Ἀλαζειρ (at Perseus).
3.i.line 35/36: the initial B is written large across the opening of these two lines.
